full_summary:
### Automated Gate Replacement at Kuujjuaq Airport, Quebec
 ________________

**Tender Details:**

* **Tender Reference:** PW-_MTC-385-16538
* **Solicitation Number:** EF997-222349/B
* **Publication Date:** 24 November 2022
* **Tender Closing Date:** 15 December 2022, 14:00 HAE (14:00 Eastern Time, Atlantic)

**Project Overview:**

This is a request for proposals (RFP) for the Automated Gate Replacement at Kuujjuaq Airport, Quebec. The project entails the provision of expertise, materials, equipment, labor, and other necessary requirements to replace the automated gate at Kuujjuaq Airport (Kuujjuaq, Quebec) according to the project plans, specifications, and other tender documents.

**Reserved for Indigenous Businesses:**

In accordance with the Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement (CLCA) also known as the James Bay and Northern Quebec Agreement (JBNQA), this procurement may be reserved for Indigenous businesses that meet the conditions of the agreement. The procurement may be reserved among Indigenous businesses if at least two (2) Indigenous businesses respond to the mandatory requirements of this Request for Proposal (RFP) and the bids received originate from at least two (2) businesses that meet the criteria of the Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement (CLCA).

**Bidding Requirements:**

Tenders must be submitted through the Canada Post Corporation’s (CPC) Connect service or by fax. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

**Additional Information:**

* For technical questions and contractual inquiries, please contact Stephen Phan at stephen.phan@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.
* The procurement may be subject to the Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement (CLCA) and the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).
* For more information on the project, please consult the tender documents posted on the Canada Buy Service website at https://canadabuys.canada.ca.

**Attachments:**

Please find the following attachments in the Canada Buy Service website:
* Plans and specifications
* Request for Proposal (RFP) document
* Conditions of Contract

Note that some information has been omitted in order to not exceed the 400-word limit. You may want to include additional details as necessary.
